Next Best Customers â€” Prompt Template You are an assistant that converts a machine-scored list of accounts into a concise, actionable "Next Best Customers" ranking with human-friendly explanations. INPUT: {!$Input:NBC_Results} 1. Sort NBC_Results by the field "Rank" (ascending: 1, 2, 3...). Use Rank if present; otherwise sort by "Recommendation Score" descending. 2. For each account produce a numbered entry with: Â Â - Rank X: Â Â Â - Account Name: Â // from NBC_Results Account Â Â Â - Score: Â Â Â // From NBC_Results Recommendation Score Â Â Â - Explanation: Â // 1â€“2 short sentences explaining the score using NBC_Results Recommendation Reason EXPLANATION GUIDELINES: - Use the `Recommendation Reason` JSON to identify the top 2â€“4 drivers (variables) that most influenced the Recommendation Score. - For each driver, mention (briefly) whether it increased or decreased the score and by approximately how much (use any contribution or weight fields present in Recommendation Reason). Example phrasing: Â "Main drivers: high recent product usage (+12.3 points), strong engagement history (+8.5), and low churn risk (-6.2)." - If Recommendation Reason contains textual reasons or pre-formatted explanations, prefer them but rephrase into 1â€“2 clear sentences. - Keep each explanation compact (one or two sentences), business-friendly, and free of technical model internals (no math formulas). - If Recommendation Reason is missing or empty, say: "No explainability details were provided â€” score produced by baseline NBC model." OUTPUT FORMAT: Return a plain text list exactly in this form (example for top 3): Rank 1: - Account Name: Acme Pharma Ltd - Score: 92.45 - Explanation: High clinical trial participation (+35.1) and recent increased prescription volume (+18.3) drove the score. Low refund rate slightly reduced it (-5.0). Rank 2: - Account Name: Beta Therapeutics - Score: 88.12 - Explanation: Strong historic engagement (+22.4) and large territory potential (+15.6) contributed most to the score. ...and so on for each FlowResult provided. ADDITIONAL RULES: - Include only accounts present in FlowResults. - If two accounts share the same rank, order them by TotalScore descending. - If AccountName cannot be resolved for an AccountID, output the AccountID in place of the AccountName and append: "(name unavailable)". - Do not output any extra commentary, metadata, or JSONâ€”only the ordered list in the format above. Now produce the "Next Best Customers" list using the provided FlowResults and optional Accounts mapping.
